countN.py.description: Ask for N, then print 1 through N.

sumN.py.description: Ask for N, then print the sum of the first N integers.

sumAll.py.description: As long as the user types a number, sum it. Print the total after the first empty line.

prod8.py.description: Print the product of the first 8 integers.

prodN.py.description: Ask for N, then print the product of the first N integers.

prodAll.py.description: As long as the user types a number, multiply it. Print after the first empty line.

avg489.py.description: Calculate and print the average of 4, 8, 9

avgN.py.description: Ask for a number N, then ask for that many integers. Calculate and print the average.

avgAll.py.description: As long as the user types a number, sum it. Print the average after the first empty line.

roman.py.description: Handle integer to roman numeral, for one input.

romanTable.py.description: Print a table of Roman Numerals. First column is 1 through 10. Second column is 10 through 100, by 10. Third column is 100 through 1000, by 100. Use pyqb's `at`.

romanMany.py.description: Ask for numbers until the user enters a blank line, printing the roman numeral each time.

grade.py.description: Ask for a test score (1 to 100). Print out the letter grade.

gradeAll.py.description: Ask for several test scores. Print the number of As, Bs, Cs, etc.
